title: Risk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Camarillo, CA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing was straightforward and informational. I applied for the position, contacted by recruiter, interview scheduled, occurred, and I accepted the position at the start of that next week. The start time was standard after offer acceptance.
Interview Questions: Situational based questions to see how I would act.

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real
Interview Descriptions: One interview with two senior managers. It was quite long but was able to get good insight on the company’s history and present structure. Many standard questions and a few specific to grants.
Interview Questions: Describe the most significant presentation or report you had to prepare.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Oxnard, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy interview with many questions to answer in one hour asked by a group of employees who worked for the clinic all through zoom. There were lots of technical difficulties through Zoom which made it harder to talk in the interview. They also never let me know if I got the job or not.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to travel to our other locations scattered across the county when needed?

title: System Administrator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: IS manager invited me for the first round of interviews and then after that I interviewed with the sys admins team and CIO, and the last one was with HR
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were about the project that I have done before. They went through my resume and asked about my experiences.

title: System Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: the process took just 2 weeks, first, the IS manager called me and he went through my resume, asked me about my experiences, and then the next interview was with CISO and other system admins (technical), they asked 8-8 questions.
Interview Questions:
1- why do you want to work here
2- some questions about my CV

title: Dental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real
Interview Descriptions: The interview was lengthy and lasted about forty-five minutes. I was interviewed by two people. They went back and forth with different types of questions so be prepared to answer all types of interview questions.
Interview Questions: how would someone describe you as?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real
Interview Descriptions: Interview composed of the manager and lead PSR asking you about 3 pages worth of questions involving scenario questions, translation, and personal questions. Translations questions there were about 3 or 4. Composing of "hi, how can I help you" to "you need to show proof of income"
Interview Questions: What would your past or current employee say about you as an employee?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed but a  long interview . It’s a one on one interview. You get interviews by the manager and a Lead. They ask triage questions.  They don’t tell you whether you get offered immediately.

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Camarillo, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very comfortable and laidback. They clearly explained the position, the salary, and the expectations. Only one clinical question, which was surprising. The overall experience was pretty easy and straightforward.
Interview Questions: How would you work with a client who has depression?

title: Provider Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at the request of recruiter. Received interview with hiring manager week I applied. Received offer the following week & negotiations were finalized within a week from the interview. Started new employee orientation less than 2 weeks after interview, during which background and drug testing were done. Interview had a nice, free flowing conversational feel.
Interview Questions: Describe how you handled a difficult situation in a previous position.

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real
Interview Descriptions: I was called after applying online. I then came in to meet the HR team. After meeting them, I felt part of the team already. I was in a panel interview style, I was asked several questions related to the position  I applied for. I felt it was a great screening and they were careful of who they hired, Which is a great thing.

title: Lcsw Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Ventura, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was concise and expedient. I was told that they would decide soon and they did! I met with two decision makers immediately and they were cordial and professional. I did not feel interview anxiety once the process started. The interviewers incorporated levity into the conversation and this allowed all of us to be ourselves.
Interview Questions: Why I would be a good fit in their organization

title: "Provider" Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Ventura, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
*Prior to interview, you have a huge packet to fill out for the background check which takes a month or more. Once you finally get an interview: One management person, one other who is also recording your answers to questions.

However, not all critical information is given in interview, or at hiring. Only after hired at specific pay, do they tell you the limits of the job. IE: non-union, no rights, management can do whatever they want.
ASK SPECIFICS  - for instance, how many hours? is there a limit?  if part-time, can they change your schedule at whim? if shift work, can you count on specific shifts?
Interview Questions: Asked about experience working with cultural issues, language barriers.

title: Office Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Clinicas Del Camino Real (Oxnard, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had a none existing interview basically they called me to set up an appointment and I filled out the paper work at an office in ventura from there I just filled out everything I needed to fill out and was taken to my work station where I was assigned my daily tasks.
